forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 4am. Mostly clear. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. West northwest wind 3 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the shadows of this tranquil night linger over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a crispness that hints at the chill awaiting the dawn. A slight chance of rain may kiss the landscape after a few hours, holding the promise of a gentle cleansing, but for now, the sky remains mostly clear. Those who find themselves waking in the early hours might notice a low hovering near forty-four, a temperature that creeps up towards the forty-six mark as the night deepens, with the soft touch of a westerly breeze weaving its way through the waking city.

Moving into Wednesday, the sun will make its entrance with a tentative grace, generously bestowing warmth upon the urban tapestry. Although a faint hint of rain lingers in the forecasts, a mostly sunny day is anticipated, and life will pulse with a spirit of hope as temperatures reach the low fifties. The sight of the horizon should be unobstructed, with only minimal fog daring to dance along the edges of the bay. Dress in layers to embrace the day: a light sweater or jacket will provide the necessary comfort as you venture into the awakening streets. With the stages of a fresh day unfurling, consider savoring a quiet walk along the waterfront or indulging in a leisurely visit to a local café, allowing the invigorating air and the gentle rhythm of passing time to wash over you as a soothing balm.
